content.body: Can someone confirm whether the change in https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/6255/files is correct per-spec?
sideshowbarker: IMO, it seems this PR just use slight different words but don't really have any real difference with the old sentences.
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: IMO, it seems this PR just use slight different words but don't really have any real difference with the old sentences.

content.body: sideshowbarker: Oh, I think I missed the interesting thing it the PR, chrome/ff inconsistency :) It seems V8 don't keep order of a, b as the original order in the array when call compareFn(a, b) ... Spec seems say nothing about that.
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: Oh, I think I missed the interesting thing it the PR, chrome/ff inconsistency :) It seems V8 don't keep order of a, b as the original order in the array when call compareFn(a, b) ... Spec seems say nothing about that.

content.body: sideshowbarker: that's correct (as of https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/1340) only for consistent comparison functions, which several of the samples discussed in that thread are not. The spec makes no guarantees about the sort order when the comparison function is not consistent
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: that's correct (as of https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/1340) only for consistent comparison functions, which several of the samples discussed in that thread are not. The spec makes no guarantees about the sort order when the comparison function is not consistent

content.body: That said it's definitely an improvement: for consistent comparison functions, `compareFn(a, b) < 0` means "put a before b, regardless of where they were originally", not "leave them in their original order"
content.formatted_body: That said it's definitely an improvement: for consistent comparison functions, compareFn(a, b) < 0 means "put a before b, regardless of where they were originally", not "leave them in their original order"

content.body: I wish the spec itself has some more explicit language for developers on this
I am very happy with the spec sections that now have the non-normative green notes sections with explanatory text
